zhousp wrote:
> 1. If jar files order will affect heritrix's job, there must have some duplicate class in the lib file.

Yes, Heritrix requires special patched versions of a couple of
classes in the Apache Jakarta HTTPClient library

These alternate versions are in the Heritrix JAR file, and thus
that JAR must appear before the HTTPClient JAR on the CLASSPATH.

Perhaps this is what you've encountered?

- Gordon @ IA
